alert.note: Alert for Carter; Greenup (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 4:43PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Greenup and Carter Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 443 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Gesling, or near Carter Caves State Park, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Grayson, Olive Hill, Carter Caves State Park, Denton, Gesling, Greenbo Lake, Oldtown, Carter, Grahn, Hopewell, Brushart, Hitchins, Warnock, Soldier and Globe. This includes Interstate 64 in Kentucky between mile markers 149 and 178. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
